model.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.game.Game

  • public final class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the state of a Chess game and all of its components. Instances of Game are to be created within the client program.
    Version:
    Mar 5, 2019
    Author:
    gemuelealudino, patricknogaj

      • getLastMove

        public Move getLastMove()
        Retrieves the last move from the Board's moveList
        Returns:
        the Move that describes the last piece to be successfully moved, otherwise null if there are no pieces moved

      • getLastKill

        public Move getLastKill()
        Retrieves the last kill from the Board's moveList
        Returns:
        the Move that describes the last piece to be killed, otherwise null if there are no pieces killed

      • toggleActive

        public void toggleActive()
        Mutator to toggle the game's status. If false (game not active), active will be switched to true. Else (game is current active), active will be switched to false.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Accessor to retrieve status of game
        Returns:
        true if game is active, false otherwise

      • isWhitesMove

        public boolean isWhitesMove()
        Accessor to determine if it is white player's move, or not
        Returns:
        true if white's move, false otherwise

      • isWillDraw

        public boolean isWillDraw()
        Accessor to determine if a player requested a draw to the other player
        Returns:
        true if draw requested, false otherwise

      • isWillResign

        public boolean isWillResign()
        Accessor to determine if player requested to resign from the game
        Returns:
        true if resign requested, false otherwise

      • isDidDraw

        public boolean isDidDraw()
        Accessor to determine if a draw has been mutually agreed upon and will be done (willDraw and drawGranted must both be true, and the values of those variables are determined during the game)
        Returns:
        true if the draw has been agreed upon, false otherwise

      • isDrawGranted

        public boolean isDrawGranted()
        Accessor to determine if a draw requested made by one player has been accepted by the other player. This is the moment when the requestee (recipient of the request) agrees to a draw after it was proposed by the requestee's opponent.
        Returns:
        true if drawGranted is true, false otherwise

      • isDidResign

        public boolean isDidResign()
        Accessor to determine if a resignation requested made by one player has been accepted by the other player. This is the moment when the requestee (recipient of the request) agrees to let their opponent resign from the game.
        Returns:
        true if didResign is true, false otherwise

      • isValidMoveInput

        public boolean isValidMoveInput()
        Accessor to determine if a move request results in a valid move and was completed by a player.
        Returns:
        true if a valid move was made by a player, false otherwise

      • isValidMoveInputWithDraw

        public boolean isValidMoveInputWithDraw()
        Accessor to determine if a move request results in a valid move and was completed by a player -- but has made a request to their opponent to end the game by draw.
        Returns:
        true if validMoveInputWithDraw is true, false otherwise

      • isValidMoveInputWithPromotion

        public boolean isValidMoveInputWithPromotion()
        Accessor to determine if a move request results in a valid move and was completed by a player -- but has made a request to promote their pawn Piece to a Queen, Bishop, Knight, or Rook.
        Returns:
        true if validMoveInputWithPromotion is true, false otherwise

      • didPromoteWhite

        public boolean didPromoteWhite()
        Called by ChessActivity::movePiece, after a valid move is completed by a player. In CLI chess, Board.java will automatically promote an eligible PAWN to a QUEEN if no preference was specified during input. For GUI chess, this method is used to determine which Pawn to promote, after the user/player selects their preference via a dialog notification.
        Returns:
        if promoteWhite is true, promoteWhite will be toggled back to false and this method returns true -- otherwise, returns false

      • didPromoteBlack

        public boolean didPromoteBlack()
        Called by ChessActivity::movePiece, after a valid move is completed by a player. In CLI chess, Board.java will automatically promote an eligible PAWN to a QUEEN if no preference was specified during input. For GUI chess, this method is used to determine which Pawn to promote, after the user/player selects their preference via a dialog notification.
        Returns:
        if promoteBlack is true, promoteBlack will be toggled back to false and this method returns true -- otherwise, returns false

      • getPawnPromoteType

        public PieceType getPawnPromoteType()
        Called by ChessActivity::movePiece, to determine the PieceType of a PAWN (PAWN_0, PAWN_1, ...)
        Returns:
        a PieceType of a PAWN to be promoted

      • overridePawnPromotion

        public void overridePawnPromotion(Position newPos,
                                  PieceType promoteType)
        Called by ChessActivity::movePiece, to override the default promotion by Board.java (allows user-selection of promotion type, since the promotion preference will not be typed in whilst inputting a move, as per CLI chess)
        Parameters:
        newPos - the new position of the promoted pawn
        promoteType - the desired PieceType for promotion

        Prints the white player's PieceSet

        Prints the black player's PieceSet

      • boardToString

        public java.lang.String boardToString()
        Returns the current state of the Game as an ASCII chess board
        Returns:
        string representation of the Game's Board instance

      • start

        public void start()
        Begins game loop

      • startFromFile

        public void startFromFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Starts a game from a String inputFilePath to an existing file. Precondition: File to inputFilePath must exist.
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath - String representing the input file to be read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On nonexistent inputFilePath

      • readInput

        public void readInput(java.lang.String input)
        Interprets a string of input representing a piece's position and desired cell position for a move -- which may include a preference for a promotion type, or a request to draw, or alternatively, a declaration to resign from the game entirely
        Parameters:
        input - EXAMPLES: "a1 a2" moves a piece from a1 to a2, "a1 a2 draw?" requests a draw to the opponent, if the opponent accepts, they will reply with "draw" otherwise, if the opponent replies with a move, the requester will have their piece moved from a1 to a2. "a1 a2 B" will move a piece from a1 to a2 and promote a pawn (if a1 is a pawn) to a bishop "resign" will end the game and the requester loses

      • getFileRankArray

        private int[] getFileRankArray(java.lang.String input)
        Parses a line of input into an integer array of a Piece's current file and rank, and the desired file and rank for a new Position
        Parameters:
        input - a line of input
        Returns:
        an integer array representing a Piece's current position and the desired position to move to

      • charToInt

        public static int charToInt(char ch)
        Takes a character and returns an int that may represent an index for a file, rank, or ordinal or a PieceType enum
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to parse
        Returns:
        an integer that represents an array index or enum ordinal

      • whitePlayMove

        private boolean whitePlayMove(int file,
                              int rank,
                              int newFile,
                              int newRank,
                              int promo)
        Piece from the white PieceSet will be moved to a new Cell on the Board
        Parameters:
        file - x axis coordinate of a requested Piece (0-7 only)
        rank - y axis coordinate of a requested Piece (0-7 only)
        newFile - x axis coordinate of the desired move (0-7 only)
        newRank - y axis coordinate of the desired move (0-7 only)
        promo - integer that represents the piece to promote to (if != -1)
        Returns:
        true if move executed successfully, false otherwise

      • blackPlayMove

        private boolean blackPlayMove(int file,
                              int rank,
                              int newFile,
                              int newRank,
                              int promo)
        Piece from the black PieceSet will be moved to a new Cell on the Board
        Parameters:
        file - x axis coordinate of a requested Piece (0-7 only)
        rank - y axis coordinate of a requested Piece (0-7 only)
        newFile - x axis coordinate of the desired move (0-7 only)
        newRank - y axis coordinate of the desired move (0-7 only)
        promo - integer that represents the piece to promote to (if != -1)
        Returns:
        true if move executed successfully, false otherwise
